      • getName

        public java.lang.String getName()
        Gets the name of this thing. This method has slightly different behavior depending on the interface (for technical reasons the same method is used for both IWorldNameable and ICommandSender):
        INameable.getName()
        Returns the name of this inventory. If this has a custom name then this should be a direct string; otherwise it should be a valid translation string.
        However, note that the translation string may be invalid, as is the case for TileEntityBanner (always returns nonexistent translation code banner without a custom name), BlockAnvil$Anvil (always returns anvil), BlockWorkbench$InterfaceCraftingTable (always returns crafting_table), InventoryCraftResult (always returns Result) and the EntityMinecart family (uses the entity definition). This is not an exaustive list.
        In general, this method should be safe to use on tile entities that implement IInventory.
        ICommandSender.getName() and Entity.getName()
        Returns a valid, displayable name (which may be localized). For most entities, this is the translated version of its translation string (obtained via EntityList.getEntityString).
        If this entity has a custom name set, this will return that name.
        For some entities, this will attempt to translate a nonexistent translation string; see MC-68446. For players this returns the player's name. For ocelots this may return the translation of entity.Cat.name if it is tamed. For item entities, this will attempt to return the name of the item in that item entity. In all cases other than players, the custom name will overrule this.
        For non-entity command senders, this will return some arbitrary name, such as "Rcon" or "Server".
        指定者:
        getName 在接口中 IWorldNameable

      • hasCustomName

        public boolean hasCustomName()
        Checks if this thing has a custom name. This method has slightly different behavior depending on the interface (for technical reasons the same method is used for both IWorldNameable and Entity):
        INameable.hasCustomName()
        If true, then getName() probably returns a preformatted name; otherwise, it probably returns a translation string. However, exact behavior varies.
        Entity.hasCustomName()
        If true, then Entity.getCustomNameTag() will return a non-empty string, which will be used by getName().
        指定者:
        hasCustomName 在接口中 IWorldNameable

      • getCapability

        @Nullable
public <T> T getCapability​(Capability<T> capability,
                           @Nullable
                           EnumFacing facing)
        从接口复制的说明: ICapabilityProvider
        Retrieves the handler for the capability requested on the specific side.
        • The return value CAN be null if the object does not support the capability.
        • The return value CAN be the same for multiple faces.

        Basically, this method functions analogously to Map.get(Object).

        指定者:
        getCapability 在接口中 ICapabilityProvider
        覆盖:
        getCapability 在类中 TileEntityLockable
        参数:
        capability - The capability to check
        facing - The Side to check from, CAN BE NULL. Null is defined to represent 'internal' or 'self'
        返回:
        The requested capability. Must NOT be null when ICapabilityProvider.hasCapability(Capability, EnumFacing) would return true.
